result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Final pre-trial conference on November 8, 2022 at 9:10 am. 
Final plea hearing on December 8, 2022 at 2:00 pm.
Jury trial on December 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:26 PM Defendant Matthew Ryan Martin in court.  Attorney Mark David Lawton in court for Matthew Ryan Martin.  Attorney Jordan Lippert in court for State of Wisconsin. Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Defendant plead not guilty. Court entered not guilty pleas, jury trial to be set. Bond continued. 3:30 PM

9:02 AM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew Ryan Martin in court.  Attorney Mark David Lawton in court for Matthew Ryan Martin. Attorney Lawton requested a preliminary hearing. 9:06 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

On Petition for Apointment of an Attorney.

9:44 AM Defendant Matthew Ryan Martin in court. Defendant applied with Public Defender office and was denied.  Court informed defendant he must repay county $100/mo beginning. 7-1-22 and each month thereafter.  Court appointed Atty Mark Lawton @ $100/hour.  Pretrial date remains.  Return date remains as well.
Indigency hearing on June 8, 2022 at 09:45 am.
